title: The 9 Best Clothing Rental Services Out There
description: And just like that, your fantasy wardrobe is within reach.
excerpt: And just like that, your fantasy wardrobe is within reach.
text: We know that you constantly hear about new trends, whether it’s via the runway, the streets, or your trusted ELLE editors. Shopping can be such a joy, but sometimes it’s draining...and occasionally it ends in buyer’s remorse. It’s daunting to try to maintain a closet that meets both personal needs and social standards. When should you stay strong and save your money? When should you give in to4 the impulse? Is capsule dressing really the answer? Fortunately, plenty of luxury fashion rental services offer a sustainable, wallet-friendly solution, and we’re dressing better because of it. Instead of buying, try borrowing. Not only can you save copious amounts of money, but it’s also the answer to the revolving door that is the trend cycle and overconsumption. If you’re curious about revamping your style and experimenting with new looks, renting gives you the flexibility to try things out without the commitment of swiping your card. Find the nine best rental services that’ll repeatedly revive your closet, below. We’ve done the research for you, taking into account how each service works, and combing through customer reviews. All you have to do is start browsing for that coveted designer bag. Rent the Runway Rent Now on Rent the RunwayBest for: Label lovers Why you’ll want it: Looking to stand out in the crowd as you catch the bouquet at your friend’s upcoming wedding? Maybe you have a snazzy job interview and want to dress to impress. Or perhaps your everyday wardrobe is in need of a tune-up. Rent the Runway has eye-grabbing occasion wear and stylishly elevated workwear, including designer pieces from brands like Tibi, Tory Burch, Reformation, and more.How it works: Choose from one of RTR’s plans and receive up to five or 10 items per month. The smaller plan offers “basic closet access” to select styles and one shipment per month. The larger plan includes RTR’s full collection and two shipments per month. All memberships allow members to rent five items at a time.The cost: $94-144/monthWhat customers are saying: “My RTR membership lets me refresh my wardrobe and try new trends without overspending on fast fashion. My closet’s always evolving and my budget can stay intact—win win!”Veronica Beard Alessia Jacket Rails Kacia Sweater7 For All Mankind Luxe Vintage Lotta Jeans Reformation Medium Chiara BagNuulyRent Now on NuulyBest for: Experimenting on a budget Why you’ll want it: With beloved brands and retailers like Anthropologie, Free People, and FarmRio, Nuuly offers a vast selection of pieces to help your personal style shine, plus exclusive brand collaborations. How it works: First, fill out a short quiz about your shape and sizing. Browse hundreds of options, and choose up to six garments per month. Laundry and clothing repairs are included in the price, and you’ll never have to worry about late fees. If you decide you simply can’t let go of any of your pieces, you can purchase them at a discount.The cost: $98/monthWhat customers are saying: “This has been an amazing and wonderful subscription service for me. The biggest value is that it stops me from being wasteful about clothes.”Allina Liu Twig Cutout Wide Leg PantsUnreal Fur Wild Dream Faux Fur JacketAnthropologie Sleeveless Halter Ruffled Tulle Midi DressHutch Shantung Feather TankArmoireRent Now on ArmoireBest for: A customized closet Why you’ll want it: Armoire takes a very personalized approach with their style quiz. After you answer a few questions about your personal style and the silhouettes that best suit you, a team of stylists generates a selection of pieces just for you. With a focus on brands owned by women and sustainable sourcing, Armoire just gets it right.How it works: Once you’ve taken the quiz, it’s time to shop. A variety of plans means ultimate flexibility. All rentals include dry cleaning, shipping, returns, and coverage for minor damages. The cost: $89-249/monthWhat customers are saying: “Armoire allows me to explore different styles easily without commitment! I love the supportive community and Armorie’s top-notch customer service!”Scotch & Soda Tiger Jacquard Single Breasted CoatBCBG Maxazria A-Line Tulle Tie Neck Midi DressEquipment Bennett Ruched Silk Button-DownBB Dakota Knit Maxi SkirtTulerieRent Now on TulerieBest for: Community-driven fashionistas—and anyone looking for a side hustle Why you’ll want it: Join in the communal closet at Tulerie, the peer-to-peer clothing rental app allowing users to rent out their wardrobes to each other. While you raid countless closets (hello vintage gems!) make money simultaneously by opening the door to yours. How it works: After an introductory video chat with the Tulerie team, vetted members are invited to open their closets and browse fellow users’ listings. Once you find a piece you love, simply request a rental from the lender for four, 10, or 20 days.To rent your own items out, list bags, shoes, clothes, and accessories, and wait for the requests to come in. Tulerie will create a USPS or FedEx label for you to ship it out. Just don’t forget to use the included cleaning fee (paid for by the borrower) to dry clean your items when they’re returned! The cost: Priced individually by piece What customers are saying: “I am absolutely thrilled with my experience using Tulerie! This platform has completely transformed the way I view my wardrobe. Instead of just a collection of clothes, I now see my closet as a money market, allowing me to justify having a larger collection than ever before.”Hermès Reversible Jacket Paris Texas Crocodile Effect 100MM BootsMaggie Marilyn Your Direction Tie TopAltuzarra Vendaval Tiered Midi DressVivrelle Rent Now on VivrelleBest for: Testing out accessories before making a discounted purchase Why you’ll want it: Think again before your next big bag splurge, because now you can rent to buy. Designer bags have a heftier price tag, but with Vivrelle, you can rent luxury brands without burning a hole in your wallet. This is especially great for those bold, occasion styles that make for great conversation starters but have limited wearability. Here, you can get that statement bag at a fraction of the cost and with none of the regret. How it works: Choose from four membership tier plans to rent up to two designer bags or pieces of jewelry per month. If you happen to find yourself in the Big Apple, drop in for a visit to the company’s New York City showroom. Special offers from brand partners and the option to purchase items at heavily discounted prices make this deal even sweeter. The cost: $45-309/monthWhat customers are saying: “Each month, when I pick out my Vivrelle bag, it feels like Christmas morning. I have had this membership since they started and have had only the most positive experiences. I don’t know how this wasn’t invented sooner!”Christian Dior Python Embellished Mini Saddle BagChanel Caviar Quilted Small Filigree Vanity CaseBottega Veneta Teen JodieLouis Vuitton Monogram Petit Sac PlatGwynnie BeeRent Now on Gwynnie BeeBest for: People with natural bodies of all sizes Why you’ll want it: Experience clothing options without limitations. Gwynnie Bee caters to sizes 10 to 32 and features styles from brands like Good American, Ralph Lauren, and Vince Camuto. Memberships range from one to 10 items per month, and with new styles launching weekly, your wardrobe will always feel fresh. How it works: Upon signing up, you’ll be asked to share your go-to sizes and brands, allowing Gwynnie Bee’s team to understand your needs and preferences. Before committing, test out the service for 50 percent off on your first rental of two items. If you love your pieces, you can buy them at a discount. The cost: $49-199/month What customers are saying: “Gwynnie Bee is a good service for any woman sizes 0 to 32. I think it’s especially awesome for babes who work in an office environment and need to look put together on a daily basis. I think the business casual options on the site are my favorite... Now that I’m not in an office environment, I use it for date-night dresses and casual everyday wear. I think that apartment dwellers with limited storage space can also benefit greatly from the service.”Estelle Pomegranate Embellished CardiganAidan Plus Size Knit Crepe Sleeveless Column GownSkies Are Blue Vegan Leather Midi SkirtEstelle Tess Satin PantNow 50% OffVince UnfoldRent Now on Vince UnfoldBest for: Brand loyalistsWhy you’ll want it: It’s no secret that Vince is a go-to for quality clothes with style. Be it a part of your foundational wardrobe or something more glamorous, Vince has options, and Unfold is a great way to try out the brand’s offerings.How it works: Explore styles and maintain 10 or more items in your virtual closet, from which you’ll receive four at a time. When you’re done with your current pieces, simply send them back in a pre-paid bag and repeat. You can also try before you buy, as Vince Unfold offers discounted pricing on pieces you can’t bear to send back. The cost: $175/monthWhat customers are saying: “The way the service works is a bit different than Rent the Runway, but once you realize how to optimize the service, it’s the most convenient one out there. I’ve been an Unfold member for over a year now and have loved every month! The more you have in your closet, the faster they are able to match you to your next box to increase the shipping time.”Vince Brushed Polo SweaterVince Stove Pipe Pull On PantVince Side Slit Slip Skirt Vince Leather Seam Front Trouser SwitchRent Now on SwitchBest for: The eclectic accessorizer Why you’ll want it: Scrolling through Switch is like taking a dive into the jewelry box of your dreams. From vintage Van Cleef to Chanel vanity cases, there’s something for even the most particular accessories-obsessed person.How it works: The number of pieces you can rent at a time depends on which membership level you opt for. Across the board, however, Switch provides two-day shipping. You can also use your accrued monthly credits toward a purchase, should you feel so inspired. And since accessories are made to be worn, your membership covers minor wear and tear. The cost: Starting at $55/month What customers are saying: “My Switch pieces were all exceptional and made accessorizing my outfits fun. I love that I can experiment with pieces that are out of my budget (or totally outside my comfort zone).”Chanel Pearl Crown ClutchGucci Metal Double G Brooch with Multicolor CrystalsVan Cleef & Arpels Citrine Amethyst Yellow Gold Cocktail Ring Givenchy Vintage Chain Link BraceletPickle Rent Now on Pickle Best for: Social media mavens Why you’ll want it: If your primary source of outfit inspiration is your Instagram feed, Pickle is making it easier than ever to get the looks you love. Keep your finger on the fashion pulse with the most recent collections through this community-based service. Rent items from the personal closets of It Girls like Remi Bader, Kit Keenan, or even ELLE’s own senior fashion commerce editor, Dale Arden Chong. Make some money while you’re at it by lending pieces from your own wardrobe, too. How it works: After selecting your haul and specifying a rental period ranging from one day to one month, you’ll choose a delivery option. Pickle ships nationwide, but customers in cities like New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, or Miami can also choose from same-day delivery or lender drop-off. The cost: Varies by pieces; no membership fee What customers are saying: “WOW. I loved using Pickle during New York Fashion Week and for all of my winter trips! I’m addicted to browsing and am always saving new pieces to rent in the future.” Hill House Home The Blythe Bow DressJacquemus Metallic JeansNow 90% OffThe Frankie Shop Peri Button Up Top ShirtNow 76% OffKaren Millen Mirror Disc SkirtFrequently Asked Questions Additional reporting by Meg Donohue, Trang Trinh, and Ashley Achenbach
html:
We know that you constantly hear about new trends, whether it’s via the runway, the streets, or your trusted ELLE editors. Shopping can be such a joy, but sometimes it’s draining...and occasionally it ends in buyer’s remorse. It’s daunting to try to maintain a closet that meets both personal needs and social standards. When should you stay strong and save your money? When should you give in to4 the impulse? Is capsule dressing really the answer?

Fortunately, plenty of luxury fashion rental services offer a sustainable, wallet-friendly solution, and we’re dressing better because of it. Instead of buying, try borrowing. Not only can you save copious amounts of money, but it’s also the answer to the revolving door that is the trend cycle and overconsumption. If you’re curious about revamping your style and experimenting with new looks, renting gives you the flexibility to try things out without the commitment of swiping your card.

Find the nine best rental services that’ll repeatedly revive your closet, below. We’ve done the research for you, taking into account how each service works, and combing through customer reviews. All you have to do is start browsing for that coveted designer bag.

Rent the Runway

      Rent Now on Rent the Runway

      Best for: Label lovers

      Why you’ll want it: Looking to stand out in the crowd as you catch the bouquet at your friend’s upcoming wedding? Maybe you have a snazzy job interview and want to dress to impress. Or perhaps your everyday wardrobe is in need of a tune-up. Rent the Runway has eye-grabbing occasion wear and stylishly elevated workwear, including designer pieces from brands like Tibi, Tory Burch, Reformation, and more.

      How it works: Choose from one of RTR’s plans and receive up to five or 10 items per month. The smaller plan offers “basic closet access” to select styles and one shipment per month. The larger plan includes RTR’s full collection and two shipments per month. All memberships allow members to rent five items at a time.

      The cost: $94-144/month

      What customers are saying: “My RTR membership lets me refresh my wardrobe and try new trends without overspending on fast fashion. My closet’s always evolving and my budget can stay intact—win win!”

      Veronica Beard Alessia Jacket

      Rails Kacia Sweater

      7 For All Mankind Luxe Vintage Lotta Jeans

      Reformation Medium Chiara Bag

      Nuuly

      Rent Now on Nuuly

      Best for: Experimenting on a budget

      Why you’ll want it: With beloved brands and retailers like Anthropologie, Free People, and FarmRio, Nuuly offers a vast selection of pieces to help your personal style shine, plus exclusive brand collaborations.

      How it works: First, fill out a short quiz about your shape and sizing. Browse hundreds of options, and choose up to six garments per month. Laundry and clothing repairs are included in the price, and you’ll never have to worry about late fees. If you decide you simply can’t let go of any of your pieces, you can purchase them at a discount.

      The cost: $98/month

      What customers are saying: “This has been an amazing and wonderful subscription service for me. The biggest value is that it stops me from being wasteful about clothes.”

      Allina Liu Twig Cutout Wide Leg Pants

      Unreal Fur Wild Dream Faux Fur Jacket

      Anthropologie Sleeveless Halter Ruffled Tulle Midi Dress

      Hutch Shantung Feather Tank

      Armoire

      Rent Now on Armoire

      Best for: A customized closet

      Why you’ll want it: Armoire takes a very personalized approach with their style quiz. After you answer a few questions about your personal style and the silhouettes that best suit you, a team of stylists generates a selection of pieces just for you. With a focus on brands owned by women and sustainable sourcing, Armoire just gets it right.

      How it works: Once you’ve taken the quiz, it’s time to shop. A variety of plans means ultimate flexibility. All rentals include dry cleaning, shipping, returns, and coverage for minor damages.

      The cost: $89-249/month

      What customers are saying: “Armoire allows me to explore different styles easily without commitment! I love the supportive community and Armorie’s top-notch customer service!”

      Scotch & Soda Tiger Jacquard Single Breasted Coat

      BCBG Maxazria A-Line Tulle Tie Neck Midi Dress

      Equipment Bennett Ruched Silk Button-Down

      BB Dakota Knit Maxi Skirt

      Tulerie

      Rent Now on Tulerie

      Best for: Community-driven fashionistas—and anyone looking for a side hustle

      Why you’ll want it: Join in the communal closet at Tulerie, the peer-to-peer clothing rental app allowing users to rent out their wardrobes to each other. While you raid countless closets (hello vintage gems!) make money simultaneously by opening the door to yours.

      How it works: After an introductory video chat with the Tulerie team, vetted members are invited to open their closets and browse fellow users’ listings. Once you find a piece you love, simply request a rental from the lender for four, 10, or 20 days.

      To rent your own items out, list bags, shoes, clothes, and accessories, and wait for the requests to come in. Tulerie will create a USPS or FedEx label for you to ship it out. Just don’t forget to use the included cleaning fee (paid for by the borrower) to dry clean your items when they’re returned!

      The cost: Priced individually by piece

      What customers are saying: “I am absolutely thrilled with my experience using Tulerie! This platform has completely transformed the way I view my wardrobe. Instead of just a collection of clothes, I now see my closet as a money market, allowing me to justify having a larger collection than ever before.”

      Hermès Reversible Jacket

      Paris Texas Crocodile Effect 100MM Boots

      Maggie Marilyn Your Direction Tie Top

      Altuzarra Vendaval Tiered Midi Dress

      Vivrelle

      Rent Now on Vivrelle

      Best for: Testing out accessories before making a discounted purchase

      Why you’ll want it: Think again before your next big bag splurge, because now you can rent to buy. Designer bags have a heftier price tag, but with Vivrelle, you can rent luxury brands without burning a hole in your wallet. This is especially great for those bold, occasion styles that make for great conversation starters but have limited wearability. Here, you can get that statement bag at a fraction of the cost and with none of the regret.

      How it works: Choose from four membership tier plans to rent up to two designer bags or pieces of jewelry per month. If you happen to find yourself in the Big Apple, drop in for a visit to the company’s New York City showroom. Special offers from brand partners and the option to purchase items at heavily discounted prices make this deal even sweeter.

      The cost: $45-309/month

      What customers are saying: “Each month, when I pick out my Vivrelle bag, it feels like Christmas morning. I have had this membership since they started and have had only the most positive experiences. I don’t know how this wasn’t invented sooner!”

      Christian Dior Python Embellished Mini Saddle Bag

      Chanel Caviar Quilted Small Filigree Vanity Case

      Bottega Veneta Teen Jodie

      Louis Vuitton Monogram Petit Sac Plat

      Gwynnie Bee

      Rent Now on Gwynnie Bee

      Best for: People with natural bodies of all sizes

      Why you’ll want it: Experience clothing options without limitations. Gwynnie Bee caters to sizes 10 to 32 and features styles from brands like Good American, Ralph Lauren, and Vince Camuto. Memberships range from one to 10 items per month, and with new styles launching weekly, your wardrobe will always feel fresh.

      How it works: Upon signing up, you’ll be asked to share your go-to sizes and brands, allowing Gwynnie Bee’s team to understand your needs and preferences. Before committing, test out the service for 50 percent off on your first rental of two items. If you love your pieces, you can buy them at a discount.

      The cost: $49-199/month

      What customers are saying: “Gwynnie Bee is a good service for any woman sizes 0 to 32. I think it’s especially awesome for babes who work in an office environment and need to look put together on a daily basis. I think the business casual options on the site are my favorite... Now that I’m not in an office environment, I use it for date-night dresses and casual everyday wear. I think that apartment dwellers with limited storage space can also benefit greatly from the service.”

      Estelle Pomegranate Embellished Cardigan

      Aidan Plus Size Knit Crepe Sleeveless Column Gown

      Skies Are Blue Vegan Leather Midi Skirt

      Estelle Tess Satin Pant

      Now 50% Off

      Vince Unfold

      Rent Now on Vince Unfold

      Best for: Brand loyalists

      Why you’ll want it: It’s no secret that Vince is a go-to for quality clothes with style. Be it a part of your foundational wardrobe or something more glamorous, Vince has options, and Unfold is a great way to try out the brand’s offerings.

      How it works: Explore styles and maintain 10 or more items in your virtual closet, from which you’ll receive four at a time. When you’re done with your current pieces, simply send them back in a pre-paid bag and repeat. You can also try before you buy, as Vince Unfold offers discounted pricing on pieces you can’t bear to send back.

      The cost: $175/month

      What customers are saying: “The way the service works is a bit different than Rent the Runway, but once you realize how to optimize the service, it’s the most convenient one out there. I’ve been an Unfold member for over a year now and have loved every month! The more you have in your closet, the faster they are able to match you to your next box to increase the shipping time.”

      Vince Brushed Polo Sweater

      Vince Stove Pipe Pull On Pant

      Vince Side Slit Slip Skirt

      Vince Leather Seam Front Trouser

      Switch

      Rent Now on Switch

      Best for: The eclectic accessorizer

      Why you’ll want it: Scrolling through Switch is like taking a dive into the jewelry box of your dreams. From vintage Van Cleef to Chanel vanity cases, there’s something for even the most particular accessories-obsessed person.

      How it works: The number of pieces you can rent at a time depends on which membership level you opt for. Across the board, however, Switch provides two-day shipping. You can also use your accrued monthly credits toward a purchase, should you feel so inspired. And since accessories are made to be worn, your membership covers minor wear and tear.

      The cost: Starting at $55/month

      What customers are saying: “My Switch pieces were all exceptional and made accessorizing my outfits fun. I love that I can experiment with pieces that are out of my budget (or totally outside my comfort zone).”

      Chanel Pearl Crown Clutch

      Gucci Metal Double G Brooch with Multicolor Crystals

      Van Cleef & Arpels Citrine Amethyst Yellow Gold Cocktail Ring

      Givenchy Vintage Chain Link Bracelet

      Pickle

      Rent Now on Pickle

      Best for: Social media mavens

      Why you’ll want it: If your primary source of outfit inspiration is your Instagram feed, Pickle is making it easier than ever to get the looks you love. Keep your finger on the fashion pulse with the most recent collections through this community-based service. Rent items from the personal closets of It Girls like Remi Bader, Kit Keenan, or even ELLE’s own senior fashion commerce editor, Dale Arden Chong. Make some money while you’re at it by lending pieces from your own wardrobe, too.

      How it works: After selecting your haul and specifying a rental period ranging from one day to one month, you’ll choose a delivery option. Pickle ships nationwide, but customers in cities like New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, or Miami can also choose from same-day delivery or lender drop-off.

      The cost: Varies by pieces; no membership fee

      What customers are saying: “WOW. I loved using Pickle during New York Fashion Week and for all of my winter trips! I’m addicted to browsing and am always saving new pieces to rent in the future.”

      Hill House Home The Blythe Bow Dress

      Jacquemus Metallic Jeans

      Now 90% Off

      The Frankie Shop Peri Button Up Top Shirt

      Now 76% Off

      Karen Millen Mirror Disc Skirt

      Frequently Asked Questions

      Additional reporting by Meg Donohue, Trang Trinh, and Ashley Achenbach
